column4: I just tried to install Ubuntu for the first time. It hangs right before it gets to the desktop with a really choppy looking Ubuntu logo. Any ideas?

I just tried to install Ubuntu for the first time. It hangs right before it gets to the desktop with a really choppy looking Ubuntu logo in the middle of a maroon background. Is this a gfx problem? if so, what should I do?
thats what I did. first i tried desktop CD, had the same problem.
you can also use the server .iso and just do "sudo aptitude install ubuntu-desktop"
I did that too. Same problem. (instead i used apt-get install ubuntu-desktop, is that the same?)
how do i get to console to do that?
the wiki says ctrl + alt + F1 will give you a console
also this might be of help https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/Nvidia
type the username password then the command
i did that when i did the server install, didn't work. should i try again?
i just went through the reconfig. i got to a certain point and it kicked me out sayin "xserver-xorg postinst warning: overwwriting possible-customised config file; backup in /etc/x11/blahblah"
that is about the extent of my knowledge, I dont have nvidia graphics card my stuff just worked, try the wiki or forums or others in here
